rnalysis.filtering.Filter.print_features¶

Filter.print_features()¶

Print the feature indices in the Filter object, sorted alphabetically and separated by newline.

Examples
>>> from rnalysis import filtering
>>> counts = filtering.Filter('tests/counted.csv')
>>> counts.print_features()
WBGene00007063
WBGene00007064
WBGene00007066
WBGene00007067
WBGene00007069
WBGene00007071
WBGene00007074
WBGene00007075
WBGene00007076
WBGene00007077
WBGene00007078
WBGene00007079
WBGene00014997
WBGene00043987
WBGene00043988
WBGene00043989
WBGene00043990
WBGene00044022
WBGene00044951
WBGene00077502
WBGene00077503
WBGene00077504
